paragraphs.content: Chapter 3
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 3

paragraphs.content: Wherefore, holy brethren, partakers of the heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our profession, Christ Jesus;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wherefore, holy brethren, partakers of the heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our profession, Christ Jesus;

paragraphs.content: Who was faithful to him that appointed him, as also Moses was faithful in all his house.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who was faithful to him that appointed him, as also Moses was faithful in all his house.

paragraphs.content: For this man was counted worthy of more glory than Moses, inasmuch as he who hath builded the house hath more honour than the house.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For this man was counted worthy of more glory than Moses, inasmuch as he who hath builded the house hath more honour than the house.

paragraphs.content: For every house is builded by some man; but he that built all things is God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For every house is builded by some man; but he that built all things is God.

paragraphs.content: And Moses verily was faithful in all his house, as a servant, for a testimony of those things which were to be spoken after;
paragraphs.contentHtml: And Moses verily was faithful in all his house, as a servant, for a testimony of those things which were to be spoken after;

paragraphs.content: But Christ as a son over his own house; whose house are we, if we hold fast the confidence and the rejoicing of the hope firm unto the end.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But Christ as a son over his own house; whose house are we, if we hold fast the confidence and the rejoicing of the hope firm unto the end.

paragraphs.content: Wherefore (as the Holy Ghost saith, To day if ye will hear his voice,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wherefore (as the Holy Ghost saith, To day if ye will hear his voice,

paragraphs.content: Harden not your hearts, as in the provocation, in the day of temptation in the wilderness:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Harden not your hearts, as in the provocation, in the day of temptation in the wilderness:

paragraphs.content: When your fathers tempted me, proved me, and saw my works forty years.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When your fathers tempted me, proved me, and saw my works forty years.

paragraphs.content: Wherefore I was grieved with that generation, and said, They do alway err in their heart; and they have not known my ways.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wherefore I was grieved with that generation, and said, They do alway err in their heart; and they have not known my ways.

paragraphs.content: So I sware in my wrath, They shall not enter into my rest.)
paragraphs.contentHtml: So I sware in my wrath, They shall not enter into my rest.)

paragraphs.content: Take heed, brethren, lest there be in any of you an evil heart of unbelief, in departing from the living God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Take heed, brethren, lest there be in any of you an evil heart of unbelief, in departing from the living God.

paragraphs.content: But exhort one another daily, while it is called To day; lest any of you be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But exhort one another daily, while it is called To day; lest any of you be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin.

paragraphs.content: For we are made partakers of Christ, if we hold the beginning of our confidence steadfast unto the end;
paragraphs.contentHtml: For we are made partakers of Christ, if we hold the beginning of our confidence steadfast unto the end;

paragraphs.content: While it is said, To day if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts, as in the provocation.
paragraphs.contentHtml: While it is said, To day if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts, as in the provocation.

paragraphs.content: For some, when they had heard, did provoke: howbeit not all that came out of Egypt by Moses.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For some, when they had heard, did provoke: howbeit not all that came out of Egypt by Moses.

paragraphs.content: But with whom was he grieved forty years? was it not with them that had sinned, whose carcases fell in the wilderness?
paragraphs.contentHtml: But with whom was he grieved forty years? was it not with them that had sinned, whose carcases fell in the wilderness?

paragraphs.content: And to whom sware he that they should not enter into his rest, but to them that believed not?
paragraphs.contentHtml: And to whom sware he that they should not enter into his rest, but to them that believed not?

paragraphs.content: So we see that they could not enter in because of unbelief.
paragraphs.contentHtml: So we see that they could not enter in because of unbelief.
